revised_title: Food Technology in the 1980s: Electromagnetic Radiation in Food Processing and Catering
tldr: This article discusses the potential impact of electromagnetic radiation, particularly radio-frequency energy and microwaves, on food technology in the 1980s. It explores demographic trends, energy consumption, and the growth of the frozen food industry. The author predicts that the use of microwaves in home and institutional cooking will increase, leading to energy savings and improved food quality.
